column2: that isn't necessarily saying much. Many Chicagoans have considered a full slab of ribs cooked in an oven and slathered in sweet and sticky BBQ sauce to be actual "BBQ". As a result
column3: there are very few restaurants that serve REAL BBQ
column4: which requires several hours of slowly smoking various types of meat (Pork Shoulder
column6: and Brisket) at a low temperature.
